title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, Lies - Collection25 (Russia4)
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 25 (Russia 4):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Akhmadov & Lanskoy - The Chechen Struggle; Independence Won and Lost (2010)

-  Aslund - Russia's Capitalist Revolution; Why Market Reform Succeeded and Democracy Failed (2007)

-  Baumann - Russian-Soviet Unconventional Wars in the Caucasus, Central Asia & Afghanistan (1993)

-  Boyd - Daughters of the KGB; Moscow's Secret Spies, Sleepers and Assassins of the Cold War (2015)

-  Cordovez & Harrison - Out of Afghanistan; the Inside Story of the Soviet Withdrawal (1995)

-  Cornell & Starr (Eds.) - The Guns of August 2008; Russia's War in Georgia (2009)

-  Devlin - Slavophiles and Commissars; Enemies of Democracy in Modern Russia (1999)

-  Evangelista - The Chechen Wars; Will Russia Go the Way of the Soviet Union (2002)

-  Fedor - Russia and the Cult of State Security; the Chekist Tradition, from Lenin to Putin (2011)

-  Fish - Democracy Derailed in Russia; the Failure of Open Politics (2005)

-  Gardner - Crimea, Global Rivalry, and the Vengeance of History (2015)

-  German - Russia's Chechen War (2003)

-  Gilligan - Terror in Chechnya; Russia and the Tragedy of Civilians in War (2010)

-  Hale - Why Not Parties in Russia; Democracy, Federalism, and the State (2006)

-  Hill & Gaddy - Mr. Putin; Operative in the Kremlin (2013)

-  HRW - 'Invisible War'; Russia's Abusive Response to the Dagestan Insurgency (2015)

-  HRW - Rights in Retreat; Abuses in Crimea (2014)

-  HRW - Up in Flames; Humanitarian Law Violations and Civilian Victims in the Conflict Over South Ossetia (2009)

-  Isby - The War in Afghanistan, 1979-1989; the Soviet Empire at High Tide (1990)

-  Juviler - Freedom's Ordeal; the Struggle for Human Rights and Democracy in Post-Soviet States (1998)

-  Lo - Russia and the New World Disorder (2015)

-  Lucas - The New Cold War; Putin's Russia and the Threat to the West (2008)

-  Morozov - Russia's Postcolonial Identity; a Subaltern Empire in a Eurocentric World (2015)

-  Myagkov et al - The Forensic of Election Fraud; Russia and Ukraine (2009)

-  Ostrow et al - The Consolidation of Dictatorship in Russia; an Inside View of the Demise of Democracy (2007)

-  Politkovskaya - A Small Corner of Hell; Dispatches from Chechnya (2003)

-  Rose & Munro - Elections without Order; Russia's Challenge to Vladimir Putin (2002)

-  Rowney & Huskey (Eds.) - Russian Bureaucracy and the State; Officialdom from Alexander III to Vladimir Putin (2009)

-  Sixsmith - The Litvinenko File (2007)

-  'Tears, Blood and Cries'; Afghanistan Since the Invasion, 1979-1984, A Helsinki Watch Report (1984)

-  Tucker-Jones - Images of War; the Soviet-Afghan War (2012)

-  van Voren - On Dissidents and Madness; from the Soviet Union of Leonid Brezhnev to the Soviet Union of Vladimir Putin (2009)

-  Wilson - Ukraine Crisis; What It Means for the West (2014)

-  Woll & Wydra (Eds.) - Democracy and Myth in Russia and Eastern Europe (2008)

-  Yekelchyk - The Conflict in Ukraine; What Everyone Needs to Know (2015)
